unnormalised: Regarding solar rooftop subsidies, a rigorous impact assessment across states like Rajasthan and Tamil Nadu is vital. Are the subsidies truly benefiting households, particularly those below the poverty line? Many applicants still await their subsidy disbursements even after 6 months. Perhaps a direct benefit transfer (DBT) model, like the PM-KISAN scheme, initiated on 01/01/2019, would be more effective. A review meeting scheduled for 10:00 hrs, 20/07/2024, with MNRE officials is crucial. The Rs. 20,000 crore allocation seems substantial, but implementation bottlenecks persist, delaying installations past the committed 31/12/2023 deadline.
normalised: Regarding solar rooftop subsidies, a rigorous impact assessment across states like Rajasthan and Tamil Nadu is vital. Are the subsidies truly benefiting households, particularly those below the poverty line? Many applicants still await their subsidy disbursements even after six months. Perhaps a direct benefit transfer D B T model, like the P M K I S A N scheme, initiated on first January two thousand and nineteen, would be more effective. A review meeting scheduled for ten o'clock hours, twentieth July two thousand and twenty four, with M N R E officials is crucial. The rupee twenty thousand crore allocation seems substantial, but implementation bottlenecks persist, delaying installations past the committed thirty first December two thousand and twenty three deadline.
